pageTitle: iTunes - Music - Tlc by Mark Mosley
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {24411=Once again browsing through itunes I came across this artist listening to Jb. Wow!!! I could not sample all the songs fast enough so I purchased the WHOLE album. Can't say which is my favorite selection because they can't occupy the number one slot at the same time. Mark plays live in the Baltimore/Washington area. I will catch one of his shows in 2014. Cat Can Play!!!, 22494=In Fall 2010, my wife purchased tickets to Mark's album release party at local restaurant. The show was great and we purchased an album for ourselves and another as a gift for my in-laws. I have over 2000+ songs in my jazz playlist (8000+ total songs) and I listen to this album in its entirety several times a week. Each song is that good! I play it while commuting to work, travel to and from my kids events, and sometimes traveling with colleagues to business meetings. Honestly, I do skip over 'Misty' because it is love song that you have to be in the mood for. To me, it brings the tempo of the album down but at the same time displays the artist's versatility and adds to the album's influential diversity. My favorite song is Quantum Leap. I play this song about 3 or more times in a row because I don't want it to end. My other favorites that get repeated are Divine Order, TLC, House Party, A Night in Baltimore, San Juan, Fontana, and JB. That's almost the entire album. Yes, the album is that good. By the way, this is not a paid endorsement and I do not know the artist. Nowadays, it is hard to find an album with 90% being consistently good. This album deserves recognition. NOW GO BUY IT!, 112238=Copyright © 2014 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.}
